meanings.definition: To straighten up or stand erect
meanings.sent1: She tried to unbow her back after sitting for hours.
meanings.sent2: The soldier unbowing his posture as the commander entered.
meanings.sent3: The tree seemed to unbow itself after the heavy snow melted.
meanings.sent4: The flowers unbowing towards the sun's warmth in the morning.
meanings.sent5: He unbow his shoulders, feeling the tension release.

meanings.definition: To refuse to yield or submit
meanings.sent1: She will unbow her decision despite the pressure.
meanings.sent2: The team unbowing to the opponent's demands.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to unbow to the mouse's playful antics.
meanings.sent4: The waves unbowing to the wind's force.
meanings.sent5: He unbow his stance, determined to stand firm.

meanings.definition: Not bending or yielding in character or behavior
meanings.sent1: Her unbow spirit inspired those around her.
meanings.sent2: The unbow oak tree stood tall in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The unbow attitude of the child surprised the teacher.
meanings.sent4: His unbow determination led him to success.
meanings.sent5: The unbow mountain range was a sight to behold.
